channel.title: Super Smash Bros melee? Luigi's mansion? Super Mario Sunshine?
channel.description: These games are a part of my childhood, along with many others. Does anyone else feel the same?

item.title: Super Smash Bros melee? Luigi's mansion? Super Mario Sunshine?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

My child consisted of all 3 of these games, and I remember my mom dropping me off in the kids center in shoprite when she went grocery shopping. I would play SSBM for that whole hour and make friends playing with the other 3 kids. I have to say though Super Mario Sunshine was the best. i have no idea why but I just loved it. Luigi’s mansion was my favorite when I was err 6-7. I kept getting stuck at one level though, can’t remember which one.

Besides these games, my #1 game as a child was piknim. It was such an awesome game that made no sense. i remember when I finally got the green piknim. Great game to this day!

Read full topic
item.source: Super Smash Bros melee? Luigi's mansion? Super Mario Sunshine?

item.title: Super Smash Bros melee? Luigi's mansion? Super Mario Sunshine?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I must say that Super Mario Sunshine was my favorite, mostly because the overall feeling of the game was great to me. I never did beat the game because I lost the disc. Super Smash Bros melee was also a good game, because I played it a lot with my friends.

Super smash bros melee! I’ve probably put 200+ hours into this, I played a tournament when I was a fourth grader at a local game shop, I came in second place and won a hat :D. Anyone heard of GameCrazy?

item.dc:creator: @Pink_Phat Pink Phat
item.description:
@Pink_Phat wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:11, topic:509338”]Metroid Prime, Metroid Prime 2 Echoes, Twilight Princess

Off topic: Does anyone have a Gamecube controller and/or a copy of Metroid Prime they want to give me? Long story short, all of my games and stuff got stolen and I’ve been dying to play it.[/quote]
If your computer can run games pretty well you may want to try out Dolphin. It’s a Wii/Gamecube emulator
